Issues.Title: Fix bug in CodeDomSerializerBase that only occurs in Release config
Issues.Body:
In DEBUG, `CodeDomSerializerBase.TraceScope(...)` initializes the field `traceScope` with a new stack and pushes a string to it. Later , in `TracingScope.Dispose()`, there is call to `traceScope.Pop()` if `traceScope` isn't null. However, the line to initialize `traceScope` was left outside of the `#if DEBUG` block while the call to `traceScope.Push(...)` was left inside. So, `TracingScope.Dispose()` attempts to pop the stack that has nothing in it.

It looks like this was just a simple misport. Moving the line back under DEBUG introduces an uninitialized field warning, and I suspect that's why it was moved out of DEBUG in the first place. However, setting the field to null in its initializer is the proper fix for that warning.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Fix bug in CodeDomSerializerBase that only occurs in Release config" (#969)

Issues.Title: [.Net Core] ComponentDesigner is not fully ported
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.0-preview6-27712-03
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Problem description:**
ComponentDesigner currently has not implemented methods PreFilterAttributes and PreFilterEvents.
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/ComponentModel/Design/ComponentDesigner.cs#L225

And I have a question about IDesignerFilter methods implementation in ComponentDesigner. Shouldn't it call the corresponding virtual methods? (the way it's done in the .NET Framework)

**Actual behavior:**
Throws NotImplementedException

**Expected behavior:**
Implemented :)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[.Net Core] ComponentDesigner is not fully ported" (#989)

Issues.Title: [.Net Core] EventHandlerService is not ported
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.0.0-preview6-27712-03
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: No

**Problem description:**
I'm facing a problem that EventHandlerService is not implemented in .net Core. 
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design/EventHandlerService.cs

It's called from the ComponentTray ctor which we use in our application
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/master/src/System.Windows.Forms.Design/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design/ComponentTray.cs#L102

**Actual behavior:**
Throws NotImplementedException

**Expected behavior:**
Implemented :)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[.Net Core] EventHandlerService is not ported" (#988)

Issues.Title: Unify line endings
Issues.Body:
Currently we have both CRLF and LF line endings "randomly" in our files.
The team agreed to use the windows style line endings. 

This task contains:
- [ ] clean up the line endings in the files
- [ ] set up .git/config (https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/Customizing-Git-Git-Configuration) to keep the settings clean in the project
- [ ] check if there is a config for the project, if yes, set it there as well
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Unify line endings" (#955)

Issues.Title: When will WinForms fully support VB.NET in .NET Core 3.0?
Issues.Body: I'm currently trying to convert a .NET Framework WinForms app over to .NET Core 3.0. I'm in the process of converting my class libraries to .NET Standard 2.0. After installing the `Microsoft.Windows.Compatibility` NuGet package to try to get Windows-specific functionality back, I'm getting type errors for WinForms controls like Buttons, Labels, GroupBoxes. i.e. `Type 'System.Windows.Forms.Button' is not defined`. Any idea of when this will be resolved? Is this an issue with the compatibility NuGet package?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "When will WinForms fully support VB.NET in .NET Core 3.0?" (#974)

Issues.Title: DesignerSerializationManager.GetType throws NRE if TypeDescriptionProviderService returns null

Issues.Title: WinForms build fails on non-windows platforms
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: (e.g. 3.0 Preview5, or daily build number, use `dotnet --info`)
* Have you experienced this same bug with .NET Framework?: Yes/No

**Problem description:**

**Build** of WinForms project fails on non-Windows platforms with missing msbuild files

I did see that #947 speaks about a similar case, but from THAT issue it is not clear the submitter wants to build to work so much as the template removed...

**Actual behavior:**
```
error MSB4019: The imported project "/home/damageboy/dotnet/sdk/3.0.100-preview5-011568/Sdks/Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop/targets/Microsoft.WinFX.targets"
```

**Expected behavior:**
Build should succeed.

**Minimal repro:**
```bash
dotnet new winforms
The template "Windows Forms (WinForms) Application" was created successfully.

Processing post-creation actions...
Running 'dotnet restore' on /tmp/xxx/xxx.csproj...
  Restore completed in 96.54 ms for /tmp/xxx/xxx.csproj.

Restore succeeded.

dotnet build
Microsoft (R) Build Engine version 16.0.462+g62fb89029d for .NET Core
Copyright (C) Microsoft Corporation. All rights reserved.

  Restore completed in 19.23 ms for /tmp/xxx/xxx.csproj.
/home/damageboy/dotnet/sdk/3.0.100-preview5-011568/Sdks/Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop/targets/Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop.targets(14,2): error MSB4019: The imported project "/home/damageboy/dotnet/sdk/3.0.100-preview5-011568/Sdks/Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop/targets/Microsoft.WinFX.targets" was not found. Confirm that the path in the <Import> declaration is correct, and that the file exists on disk. [/tmp/xxx/xxx.csproj]

Build FAILED.

/home/damageboy/dotnet/sdk/3.0.100-preview5-011568/Sdks/Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop/targets/Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop.targets(14,2): error MSB4019: The imported project "/home/damageboy/dotnet/sdk/3.0.100-preview5-011568/Sdks/Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop/targets/Microsoft.WinFX.targets" was not found. Confirm that the path in the <Import> declaration is correct, and that the file exists on disk. [/tmp/xxx/xxx.csproj]
    0 Warning(s)
    1 Error(s)

Time Elapsed 00:00:00.78
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WinForms build fails on non-windows platforms" (#971)

Issues.Title: Add Tests related to Design types in System.Windows.Forms.Design.Editors
Issues.Body:
We have a gap in our testing in System.Windows.Forms.Design.Editors/src/System/Windows/Forms/Design
and System.Windows.Forms.Design.Editors/src/System/Drawing/Design
